thread.title: Artic airmass will send temperatures plummeting Sunday in D-FW; cold will linger for days
thread.title_full: Artic airmass will send temperatures plummeting Sunday in D-FW; cold will linger for days

author: Lana Ferguson
title: Artic airmass will send temperatures plummeting Sunday in D-FW; cold will linger for days
text:
Lows will be in the 20s early through at least Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. By Lana Ferguson Breaking News Reporter
Jan. 3, 2025 | Updated 45 minutes ago |
2 min. read A group of people jog along White Rock Lake Trial at White Rock Lake in Dallas, Saturday, Dec. 24, 2022. (Elías Valverde II / Staff Photographer)
North Texans will need to be ready to bundle up Sunday night when an Artic airmass sends temperatures plunging .
The artic front’s chilling impact on temperatures will linger for several days.
Advertisement Friday and Saturday are expected to have mild temperatures with highs around the 60s. Sunday is also expected to begin in the 60s before the temperature drops roughly 20 degrees by the afternoon , according to KXAS-TV (NBC5).
Advertisement Related: Polar vortex could send North Texas temperatures plunging next week. ERCOT is preparing
